attributes.Title: Positive Quotes Generator (Japanese)
attributes.Summary: This app is designed to improve mental health. It provides positive quotes and users are able to add them to their favourites list.
attributes.Description:
Highlight of the website:  

  • Authentication using spring security and jwt token for secure login
  • Ability to create a favourites list of quotes users like
  • Protected routes using middleware
  • Quotes are available in three languages:Japanese, English and Korean
  • Implementation of loading skelton while fetching favourites data for better user experience

attributes.Title: Tech Event Finder
attributes.Summary: This app is designed for those interested in discovering upcoming tech events in Vancouver!
attributes.Description:
This app provides a list of tech events in Vancouver.   

Highlight of the website:  

  • Authentication using next auth for secure login
  • Ability to create a favourites list of tech events by liking them.

attributes.Title: Sustainable Hub
attributes.Summary: This app is designed to help people live a more sustainable lifestyle by providing suggestions for sustainable activities in their daily lives.
attributes.Description:
This app provides a list of companies that provides sustainable services/products in Vancouver.   

Highlight of the website:  

  • Authentication using Passport.js for secure login
  • Ability to create a customized list of favorite companies by liking them or adding new ones
  • Form validation using Validator.js for input data
  • Session storage to keep the user logged in until they manually log out
  • Implementation of all CRUD methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) through a total of 12 APIs

attributes.Title: Lost and Found
attributes.Summary: This web app is for reporting lost items. It has CRUD operations which allows users to create a post, upload an image of a found item and edit the item after it’s posted as well as deactivate the post
attributes.Description:
• Images are stored in the cloud using Cloudinary. It provides an URL for each image so we only store the URLs in the database instead of image themselves. This significantly reduces the amount of data stored.
  • User can easity report items they found and and disable the post found someone claimed the item.

attributes.name: full stack app
attributes.alternativeText: Lost and found app demo gif

attributes.Title: Green Around The World
attributes.Summary: I created the client-side with Angular and server-side with Strapi (headless cms) and images are stored in Cloudinary.
attributes.Description:
Highlights: 

My work involved both client-side and server-side development as well as designing a logo and branding. 
Angular is used for client side and APIs were created with Strapi, a headless CMS. 
Also, I developed the e-commerce website using Node.js, which includes the five APIs. Data is stored in MySQL and I used five stored procedures. 

I followed DevOps methodology and created this e-commerce site. Data in Strapi is shared with mobile app.

attributes.Title: Willems Berry Farm
attributes.Summary: WordPress website I created for Willems Berry Farm.
attributes.Description:
My role was to redesign and develop their existing website. As my clients use a CMS to upload and edit their websites, I built a WordPress site for them.   
Highlight of the website:  

  • A gallery page that is integrated with their instagram feeds.
  • Enhanced accessibility and SEO
  • Created customized icons

attributes.Title: Mobile Flowers
attributes.Summary:
I created a florist webpage with PHP and MySQL.
It has a search function based on four occasions.
attributes.Description:
Highlights:

All data comes from MySQL Database.
I used PHP to call two stored procedures. 
The search function includes four occasions; Valentine's day, birthdays, memorials, and weddings. 
Each item has a carousel with two different images. 
Branding and designing
The project brief mentions that most customers access the site through their phones and tablets. So I called it mobile flowers: flowers on the fly. It gives the impression that the flower shop can make flower bouquets quickly on-the-fly! I used colours that are warm and inviting. 
Also, the webpage is fully responsive.

attributes.name: flowermobile.png
attributes.alternativeText: Web development a hero image for mobile flower website

attributes.Title: My To Do List
attributes.Summary: This to do list has log in and sign up features. Once they logged in, they can see tasks they added.
attributes.Description:
Details

  • Log in and sign up authentication is implemented by using passport.js. Sign-up and login also have form validation. The front end is created with EJS and the back end is created with node.js and MongoDB.
  • Once you created an account and logged in and add some tasks, these tasks will be saved in MongoDB.
  • Even when you log out and log back in, you will see all the tasks you added in the past (as long as you didn't delete them from the list).
  • Double click to complete a task. Click the trash bin icon to delete the task.
  • Users can see how many tasks are incomplete.

attributes.name: full stack to do app
attributes.alternativeText: To do list app demo gif

attributes.Title: The Cakery
attributes.Summary: A website I designed and developed from scratch for The Cakery.
attributes.Description:
Highlights:

The Cakery is a fun bakery that sells pop culture themed cakes and pastries. The Cakery, a.k.a topical boutique is a high end bakery that is playful and has a cheeky twist.

 

  • I designed the logo and edited all the images with Adobe photoshop and illustrator. 
  • GSAP is used in the about page so that each content pops up as you scroll down the page. 
  • Implemented a great amount of CSS animation to make the website playful.

attributes.Title: Reciprocity
attributes.Summary: Based on my research around common freelancers' problems, I designed a mobile app called Reciprocity.
attributes.Description: Reciprocity app for freelancers. My case study includes - Google Forms survey - Two interviews - Two Personas - Two user journey maps - Competitive analysis - Site map - Task Flow - Information architecture - Sketches - Wireframes - Mockups

attributes.Title: Wakie Wakie
attributes.Summary: I designed an app called Wakie Wakie. This app alerts people when their train gets close to their destination.
attributes.Description: My research focused on people who have difficulty waking up before they arrive at their destinations. I then studied other alert apps. Once I had a better understanding of the problems, I developed a wireframe and mockups.

attributes.name: wakiwakiehomepage.png
attributes.alternativeText: UX/UI design project Wakie Wakie home page
